questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 1/2 lbs of ground beef, or 4-5 ounces of cooked steak.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of red meat do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 3 eggs, 1 cup of yogurt or milk, or 4 slices of cheese.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of dairy products or eggs do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 1 apple, orange or banana; 1 cup of diced fruit; 2 apricots, kiwis, or plums; 1 potato or tomatol; 1/2 cup of marinara sauce; 3/4 cup of cooked vegetables; 1 cup of salad.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of fruits and vegetables do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 2 slices of bread; 1 bagel, roll, or english muffin, 1/2 cup of rice, pasta, quinoa, or oatmeal; 1 cup of dry cereal; 1 slice of cake; 2 medium chocolate chip cookies.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of grains and baked products do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 4-5 ounces of cooked chicken/turkey; 7 chicken nuggets; 4 chicken wings; 5 slices of deli turkey.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of poultry do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 4-5 ounces of cooked pork.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of pork do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 4-5 ounces of cooked fish; 8 pieces of sushi/sashimi; 10 pieces of shrimp; 4-5 large scallops or 6-8 clams.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of seafood do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 24 almonds; 18 cashews; 35 peanuts; 12 macadamia nuts; 7 walnuts.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: On average, how many portions of nuts do you eat in a week?

questions.metaData:
A portion consists of: 4-5 ounces of processed food.
Source: Christopher M. Jones and Daniel M. Kammen,  Quantifying Carbon 
Footprint Reduction Opportunities for U.S. Households and Communities. 
Supporting Materials. Environ. Sci. Technol., 2011, 45 (9), pp 
4088–4095.
questions.text: How many portions of processed food do you eat in a week?
